thread.title: The most awesomely gross costumes we saw at Zombie March Boston X - Massachusetts news
thread.title_full: The most awesomely gross costumes we saw at Zombie March Boston X - Massachusetts news

author: boston.com
title: The most awesomely gross costumes we saw at Zombie March Boston X - Massachusetts news
text:
This Zombie doctor proved that nobody is safe from being infected. He shambled down Newbury Street past the Church of the Covenant. Emily Anderson / Boston.com This cosplayer wore intricate, cartoon-like face makeup as she paraded down Newbury with fellow participants. Emily Anderson / Boston.com Jessica Claflin brought a taste of Sailor Moon to the march, wearing a rose-printed dress and pink wig with her zombie makeup. Emily Anderson / Boston.com Mike Balestra and Alicia Lomba were geared up to take on the undead, wearing combat boots and carrying daggers and guns. Emily Anderson / Boston.com This marcher’s super-detailed makeup mimicked the decay of human flesh. Emily Anderson / Boston.com The only thing this zombie chef was serving up on Saturday was a hearty dose of horror. Emily Anderson / Boston.com Bailey Devall and Eric Studley posed for a gruesome photo right before the march began. Emily Anderson / Boston.com A young zombie apocalypse survivor held a sign in protest during Saturday’s march. Emily Anderson / Boston.com The family that gets infected together stays together. From left to right: Katie Nolan, Autumn Blanchard, Josh Blanchard, Dan Harriman, and Rich Blanchard. Emily Anderson / Boston.com Tayla Boon looked menacing and her face and chest wounds oozed as she waited for the march to kick off. Emily Anderson / Boston.com These marchers rocked hyper-realistic makeup complete with gnarly face wounds and ominous handprints. Emily Anderson / Boston.com Deadpool made an appearance at the march, pictured here outside Towne Stove & Spirits on Boylston Street. Emily Anderson / Boston.com Miz Sylver, left, had a revolting zombie bite on her forearm while Nick Rosen, right, brought the Sox to the zombie apocalyse. Emily Anderson / Boston.com Justin Harris and Justin Hansen brought paramilitary backup to the zombie apocalypse as they marched down Winter Street in Downtown Crossing. Emily Anderson / Boston.com Tommy Ryan completed his gory costume with a massive chainsaw wound, spilling guts, and a brain to nosh on as he shambled around town. Emily Anderson / Boston.com This zombie duo stuck together throughtout the whole march. Emily Anderson / Boston.com Participants crossed from Exeter Street to Boylston Street on their way back from the Prudential Center. Emily Anderson / Boston.com Dan Harriman tied together his costume with a Hannibal Lecter-esque mask and a healthy dose of blood and gore. Emily Anderson / Boston.com Luke Tiujillo offered free hugs to people congregating outside of Boston’s South Station. Emily Anderson / Boston.com This marcher’s homemade facial prosthetic had heads turning as the crew made their way down Boylston Street. Emily Anderson / Boston.com Advertisement
